meanings.definition: A white, insoluble protein formed from fibrinogen during the clotting of blood.
meanings.sent1: The fibrin helped stop the bleeding by forming a clot.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study how fibrin works in blood clotting.
meanings.sent3: The fibrin in the blood clot looked like a fluffy cloud.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as strong as fibrin in forming a bond.
meanings.sent5: The image of fibrin clotting blood stuck in his mind like glue.

meanings.definition: A fibrous protein involved in the clotting of blood.
meanings.sent1: The fibrin fibers intertwined to create a clot.
meanings.sent2: The nurse explained the role of fibrin in stopping bleeding.
meanings.sent3: The fibrin fibers danced together in the blood vessel.
meanings.sent4: His loyalty was as strong as the fibrin fibers holding the clot together.
meanings.sent5: The importance of fibrin in blood clotting was crystal clear to the students.
